intro: Diplycosia luzonica var. pubens, commonly known as the Luzon pubescent diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
